metadata.description: Restructure README from 1,001-line reference to focused ~250-line introduction, preserving all content in organized docs/
objectives: Balance: 40% getting started, 30% purpose/benefits, 30% essential reference
Use factual, developer-centric language (no marketing copy)
Preserve all information in properly organized docs/
assumptions: Multi-model consensus recommendations inform content strategy
gemini-cli README serves as quality benchmark
All detailed content preserved in new documentation structure

metadata.purpose: Establish new documentation files to preserve detailed content before simplifying README

details: Extract 'Core Concepts' section from current README
Deep dive into specs, tasks, and dependencies
Add examples and diagrams where helpful
Ensure progressive disclosure of complexity
Extract skills reference tables from README
Include detailed examples for each skill
Add usage patterns and common workflows
Cross-reference with workflows.md where relevant
Extract 'Common Workflows' section from README
Include multiple workflow examples (5-6 examples)
Add step-by-step instructions with commands
Include troubleshooting tips for each workflow
Extract all configuration details from README
Document .sddconfig, environment variables, provider configs
Include configuration examples for common scenarios
Add configuration troubleshooting section
Extract CLI reference tables from README
Document all sdd commands with options and examples
Include output examples for each command
Add CLI usage tips and best practices
Extract troubleshooting section from README
Organize by problem category (installation, runtime, validation, etc.)
Include common error messages and solutions
Add debugging tips and diagnostic commands
Extract advanced topics from README
Include design patterns and extension points
Document customization and integration options
Add examples of advanced usage scenarios

metadata.command: ls docs/core-concepts.md docs/skills-reference.md docs/workflows.md docs/configuration.md docs/cli-reference.md docs/troubleshooting.md docs/advanced-topics.md

metadata.expected: Each doc file contains relevant content from current README with proper formatting and cross-references

metadata.purpose: Enhance existing docs with content from current README

details: Add architecture diagrams from current README
Include project statistics (modules, classes, functions)
Add project structure details
Ensure consistency with new documentation structure

verify-2-1.title: Architecture doc enhanced with README content

metadata.expected: Architecture doc includes diagrams, stats, and structure details from README

verify-2-2.title: All cross-references point to correct locations

metadata.expected: Links between documentation files work correctly

metadata.purpose: Replace current README with streamlined version following approved structure

details: Replace with new structure (~250 lines total):
- Header (tagline, badges) - 5 lines
- What & Why (problem → solution → outcome) - 30-40 lines
- Quick Start (install + first example) - 40-50 lines
- How It Works (core concepts, minimal) - 60-80 lines
- Essential Reference (key skills table) - 40-50 lines
- Documentation Links - 20-30 lines
- Footer (version, license, help) - 5 lines
Use factual, developer-centric language
Follow problem → solution → outcome framework
Link to all new documentation locations

metadata.expected: README includes: Header, What & Why, Quick Start, How It Works, Essential Reference, Documentation Links, Footer
No marketing language like 'revolutionary', 'game-changing'; uses problem → solution → outcome framework

Links to docs/core-concepts.md, docs/skills-reference.md, docs/workflows.md, docs/configuration.md, docs/cli-reference.md, docs/troubleshooting.md, docs/advanced-topics.md, docs/architecture.md all work

metadata.purpose: Ensure all content is preserved, links work, and messaging is appropriate

verify-4-1.title: No content lost from original README

metadata.expected: All sections from original 1,001-line README exist somewhere in new documentation structure
README follows gemini-cli patterns: concise, scannable, action-oriented, links to detailed docs

journal.title: Task Completed: docs/core-concepts.md
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Created docs/core-concepts.md (338 lines) by extracting and enhancing Core Concepts section from README. Content includes: specifications structure and lifecycle, task categories and time tracking, dependency orchestration with examples, multi-model consultation process, documentation integration and query capabilities, context tracking with limits, and subagent architecture. Added progressive disclosure with tables, examples, and cross-references to other docs. File verified readable and properly formatted.

journal.title: Task Completed: docs/skills-reference.md
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Created docs/skills-reference.md (685 lines) by extracting and greatly expanding the skills reference from README. Comprehensive documentation for all 12 skills organized by category: Planning & Workflow (sdd-plan, sdd-next, sdd-update, sdd-validate, sdd-render), Quality Assurance (sdd-plan-review, sdd-fidelity-review, sdd-modify, run-tests), Documentation & Analysis (doc-query, llm-doc-gen), and Workflow Commands (/sdd-begin, /sdd-setup). Each skill includes purpose, when to use, detailed example usage with realistic conversations, what it does, common patterns/operations table, and relevant configuration. Added skill invocation patterns and composition workflows. File cross-references other docs properly.

journal.title: Task Completed: docs/workflows.md
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Created docs/workflows.md (703 lines) by extracting and vastly expanding Common Workflows section from README. Comprehensive step-by-step guides for 7 major workflows: Plan and Implement a Feature (full lifecycle from spec creation to completion), Resume After Break (handling multiple active specs), Generate and Query Documentation (including scoped context with --plan/--implement), Multi-Model Spec Review (parallel AI consultation), Verify Implementation Fidelity (compliance checking), Debug Test Failures (AI-powered debugging), and Create Pull Request (AI-generated PR descriptions). Each workflow includes detailed steps, realistic command/response examples, what happened explanations, and troubleshooting tables. File properly cross-references other docs.

journal.title: Task Completed: docs/configuration.md
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Created docs/configuration.md (720 lines) by extracting and comprehensively expanding all configuration details from README. Complete reference covering: Quick Setup with /sdd-setup, Project Configuration (directory structure, settings.local.json, gitignore recommendations), CLI Configuration (sdd_config.json with work_mode, output formatting, verbosity, token savings tables), AI Model Configuration (ai_config.yaml with tool priority, per-skill configuration, provider details, read-only restrictions), Git Integration (git_config.json with auto-branch/commit/push, file staging, AI PR settings), Configuration Precedence (CLI flags > config file > defaults), Environment Variables (API keys), 4 detailed Configuration Examples for different scenarios (solo dev, team, context-conscious, premium quality), and comprehensive Troubleshooting section. File properly cross-references other docs.

journal.title: Task Completed: docs/cli-reference.md
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Created docs/cli-reference.md (875 lines) by extracting and comprehensively expanding CLI reference from README. Complete command-line documentation organized by category: Spec Operations (create, activate-spec, next-task, prepare-task, update-status, complete-task, validate, list-specs, progress with all options and examples), Documentation Commands (doc generate, analyze-with-ai, stats, search, complexity, callers, callees, call-graph, scope with --plan/--implement, impact), Testing Commands (test run, debug, check-tools), Review Commands (plan-review, fidelity-review, render). Each command includes syntax, arguments, options, examples with realistic output, and notes. Added Global Options (output control, verbosity, help), Output Formats comparison (JSON/Rich/Plain with examples), and CLI Usage Tips (7 practical tips including jq piping, aliases, scripting patterns). File emphasizes that regular users should use skills/natural language with Claude Code. Properly cross-references other docs.

journal.title: Task Completed: docs/troubleshooting.md
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content: Created docs/troubleshooting.md (625 lines) by extracting and comprehensively expanding troubleshooting content from README. Complete troubleshooting guide organized by category: Installation Issues (skills not working, CLI not found, Python version, plugin updates), Setup and Configuration (sdd-setup problems, permissions, invalid JSON), Skill Execution Issues (timeouts, no active work, blocked tasks), CLI Command Issues (unrecognized commands, output format), Validation Errors (circular dependencies, invalid references, schema failures), AI Tool Failures (provider availability, rate limiting, multi-model failures), Git Integration Issues (git config, gh auth, auto-commit), Documentation Generation Issues (missing docs, language support, size issues), Performance Issues (slow operations, context limits, memory usage). Each section includes Symptoms, Diagnosis commands, and detailed Solutions with code examples. Added Getting More Help section with log locations, debug mode, issue reporting guidelines, and community resources. Quick Reference section for common commands. Properly cross-references other docs.
